title: This Gun For Hire (1942 film noir)
description:
<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0035432/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0035432/</a>

Early-period film noir with jingoist overtones.

I hate Alan Ladd as an actor, but some people certainly enjoy him. I always laugh when he smiles that beaver-grin way he does with his front teeth bucking out. Awful.

I especially like the part where Ladd tells Lake not to run, otherwise "they will know you're not a man." Nice line.  We also see a favorite film-noir setting, the railyard, used to good advantage. For another use of the railyard, see The Setup, http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/5248666/The_Setup_(1949_film_noir)

And is there something Fritz Lang-ish about the big set for the office?

*********

Please, please seed. Thank you.
